text: I think at present the signal-to-noise ratio is too low, and I don't understand how the answering process is supposed to look like - currently it looks like people are answering on Discourse like a normal post, but presumably the person asking on Slack doesn't see this? And there are different answers on Slack and Discourse, as people answering on either venue don't necessarily check the other? Not sure how feasible this is but my preferred way would be for manual triggering of the bot, and ideally also with a thread- rather than post-bridge, i.e. the bot offers to cross-post in a thread and then the original question plus answers get posted

elements.text: I think at present the signal-to-noise ratio is too low, and I don't understand how the answering process is supposed to look like - currently it looks like people are answering on Discourse like a normal post, but presumably the person asking on Slack doesn't see this? And there are different answers on Slack and Discourse, as people answering on either venue don't necessarily check the other? Not sure how feasible this is but my preferred way would be for manual triggering of the bot, and ideally also with a thread- rather than post-bridge, i.e. the bot offers to cross-post in a thread and then the original question plus answers get posted

text: The other issue that is probably insurmountable (unless someone can train GPT-3 to do this?) is that the original questions don't make great post titles on Discourse, a title like "So I'm running into this weird issue, let me try to explain..." doesn't really work well with the Discourse topic overview

text: Iiuc the idea is to archive the helpdesk to make it searchable and increase the chance that someone stumbles on an answer via Google or Discourse search - it seems to me cross-posting a helpdesk thread on request with a marked solution would achieve that goal, while minimising the confusion created if people on Discourse were trying to interact with a thread on helpdesk that can't hear them

elements.text: Iiuc the idea is to archive the helpdesk to make it searchable and increase the chance that someone stumbles on an answer via Google or Discourse search - it seems to me cross-posting a helpdesk thread on request with a marked solution would achieve that goal, while minimising the confusion created if people on Discourse were trying to interact with a thread on helpdesk that can't hear them
